intro: Cosmos sherffii, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada cosmos, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its delicate, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It has hairy stems and leaves, which help reduce water loss. Cosmos sherffii is often found in meadows and open woodlands at high elevations.
